Trial_Design.evidence: A within-trial economic evaluation of the Fibrinogen Replenishment in Surgery (FIBERS) randomized clinical trial

Participants.evidence: Participants included a subset of 495 adult patients from the FIBERS trial who underwent cardiac surgery and developed active bleeding and acquired hypofibrinogenemia requiring fibrinogen replacement.

Intervention.evidence: Fibrinogen concentrate (4 g per dose) or cryoprecipitate (10 units per dose) randomized (1:1) up to 24 hours postcardiopulmonary bypass.

Objective.evidence: Objective: To determine cost-effectiveness of fibrinogen concentrate vs cryoprecipitate for managing active bleeding in adult patients who underwent cardiac surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Effectiveness outcomes included number of ABPs administered within 24 hours and 7 days of cardiopulmonary bypass.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Participants included a subset of 495 adult patients from the FIBERS trial

Number_Analysed.evidence: Patient level costs for 495 patients were evaluated

Result_Outcome.evidence: Median (IQR) total 7-day ABP cost was CAD $2280 (US dollars [USD] $1697) (CAD $930 [USD $692]-CAD $4970 [USD $3701]) in the fibrinogen concentrate group and CAD $2770 (USD $1690) (IQR, CAD $1140 [USD $849]-CAD $5000 [USD $3723]) in the cryoprecipitate group.

Harms.evidence: ABP transfusions and adverse events were similar in both treatment groups.
